body:
Ticket to discuss release related issues.

- How far are we from a release?
- Is anything left open that should be included?
- Can and should we include some of https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4029 ? EDIT: -> Postponed to 3.3.

Link to release milestone:
https://github.com/cython/cython/milestone/75

comment_data.body:
I think: 
* It would be nice to include T strings (given that it's a pretty small change) 
* It would be nice to include https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6983 (but we shouldn't include any follow-ups to it right now)
* It would be nice to include https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6967 because it's make isolated module state/subinterpreters a lot more usable. However, I wouldn't be too upset if it slipped this time.
* We should either include all of pattern matching or none of it. I think a partial implementation will probably cause more complaints than no implementation.

I don't think there's much else I feel too strongly about right now.

> * How far are we from a release?

To me I don't think there's any huge features in 3.2 (unlike 3.0 and 3.1). it's just "here's some new stuff and improvements". So it may just be a case of drawing a line somewhere and releasing that

> It would be nice to include https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6983 (but we shouldn't include any follow-ups to it right now)

Yes that would be great. There is only one open question missing point. PR currently introduces warnings of not used function. This can be fixed by splitting utility function...

I propose following additions:
* #7134 - in the bug, there is proposal for very simple fix, if it is true I think we can put it in the release
* #6965 - this would be nice, not sure how controversial the PR is. At least it would be great to allow functions declare `-> None` as return type...

> We should either include all of pattern matching or none of it. I think a partial implementation will probably cause more complaints than no implementation.

Let's postpone that feature to 3.3.

- https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6983 is pretty much on its way.
- https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6965 is ready for merging
- https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6967 is postponed

That gets us ready for a beta release. Any more last minute proposals and comments?

Maybe https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7178 if it works when rerun? (If not then it probably isn't worth waiting for).

But I don't think there's much that specifically needs to be in this release.

> That gets us ready for a beta release. Any more last minute proposals and comments?

I created fix of the bug #4270. The fix is pretty isolated it should be quick to get it to final form - see #7224

Cython 3.2b1 is on PyPI. Have fun.

Note that we switched some platforms (< 1% downloads) from Python version specific wheels to abi3 wheels, for several reasons. We wanted to reduce the total amount of wheels to build, but still support all relevant platforms, and also start using the Limited API / Stable ABI for our own releases.

See https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7227 regarding the abi3 wheels.

> Cython 3.2b1 is on PyPI. Have fun.

For those that want to test through conda-forge, https://github.com/conda-forge/cython-feedstock/pull/176 was just merged, builds should be online in ~30min. You can then use `<your_favourite_tool> install -c conda-forge/label/cython_dev cython=3.2` to get it.
PyPI has a second beta with bug fixes to unblock users. I think we're close to a release, so please give it a test run if you haven't already.

> PyPI has a second beta with bug fixes to unblock users. I think we're close to a release, so please give it a test run if you haven't already.

It seems that b2 causes tests failing on my local environment - not sure why test suit passes in CI - see #7268

> It seems that b2 causes tests failing on my local environment - not sure why test suit passes in CI - see [#7268](https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/7268)

This was found due to more restrictive C compiler flags and is fixed in the master branch and the nightly wheels. I'd like to wait a couple of more days before pushing out another release (then hopefully rc1), unless this really blocks users from testing.

labels.description: Release planning and general project goal discussions
labels.name: Planning

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Prepare release of 3.2
